caption: This photograph captures an intimate indoor setting featuring two individuals apparently enjoying a lighthearted moment together. The person on the left, wearing a yellow t-shirt and a blue hat with a logo, is holding several U.S. dollar bills in their hands, with a playful expression on their face. The person on the right, clad in a striking patterned robe or blanket and a dark wide-brimmed hat, is also holding a dollar bill. The lighting is dim, casting deep shadows and highlighting the vivid colors of their clothing against a dark background. In the background, there appears to be a closet or an open wardrobe containing various items of clothing. The overall mood of the scene is candid and cheerful, emphasizing a sense of camaraderie or shared amusement between the two individuals.
title: Black family count their cash in their apartment in South Side Chicago. From 1960 to 1970 the percentage of Chicago blacks with an income of $7,000 or more jumped from 26 to 58%. Median black income during the period increased from $4,700 to $7,883. But the median income of whites increased even more and widened the gap from $3,251 in 1960 to $3,603 in 1970.
